name: Shelter
text:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.
Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.
Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.

name: Sheltered Aerie
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: Dromoka's scalelords patrol the skies over Arashin, offering her people safety from the harsh world.

name: Sheltered Valley
text:
If Sheltered Valley would enter the battlefield, instead sacrifice each other permanent named Sheltered Valley you control, then put Sheltered Valley onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control three or fewer lands, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

name: Sheltering Ancient
text:
Trample
Cumulative upkeep—Put a +1/+1 counter on a creature an opponent controls. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

name: Sheltering Prayers
text: Basic lands each player controls have shroud as long as that player controls three or fewer lands. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: "It matters not if the gods hear my prayers. Jamuraa does."

name: Sheltering Word
text: Target creature you control gains hexproof until end of turn. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (A creature with hexproof can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

name: Sheoldred, Whispering One
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.

name: Shepherd of Rot
text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Zombie on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"My priests swore loyalty to the Cabal not until death, but beyond it."
—Cabal Patriarch

"My priests swore loyalty to the Cabal not until death, but beyond it."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Shepherd of the Lost
text: Flying, first strike, vigilance

editions.flavor:
"Should you fall in the wilds, lift your voice to the Sky Realm. The one who answers will be your salvation."
—Emeria's Creed

name: Shichifukujin Dragon
text:
When Shichifukujin Dragon comes into play, put seven +1/+1 counters on it.
 {R}{R}{R}, Remove two +1/+1 counters: Put three +1/+1 counters on Shichifukujin Dragon at end of turn. Play this ability as a sorcery.

name: Shidako, Broodmistress
text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Shield Bearer
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a Skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Shield Dancer
text: {2}{W}: The next time target attacking creature would deal combat damage to Shield Dancer this turn, that creature deals that damage to itself instead.

editions.flavor: The harder your strike, the stronger her defense.

name: Shielded Aether Thief
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Whenever Shielded Aether Thief blocks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Conflict breeds opportunity.

name: Shielded by Faith
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has indestructible.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may attach Shielded by Faith to that creature.

name: Shielded Passage
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

editions.flavor: Izzet delved into the depths of Ravnica's past, and Selesnya followed without fear.

name: Shieldhide Dragon
text:
Flying, lifelink
Megamorph {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Shieldhide Dragon is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Dragon creature you control.

name: Shielding Plax
text:
({G/U} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
Enchant creature
When Shielding Plax enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.

name: Shieldmage Advocate
text: {T}: Return target card from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn by a source of your choice.

editions.flavor: "Our unity conquers all fears."

name: Shieldmage Elder
text:
Tap two untapped Clerics you control: Prevent all damage target creature would deal this turn.
Tap two untapped Wizards you control: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn.

editions.flavor: "You may fight if I deem your cause worthy."

name: Shield Mate
text: Sacrifice Shield Mate: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: They bear weightier burdens than the shields they carry.

name: Shieldmate's Blessing
text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Even land dwellers may call for Emeria's grace in times of need."
—Emeria's Creed

name: Shield of Duty and Reason
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green and from blue.

editions.flavor: The duty: to defend. The reason: to survive.

name: Shield of Kaldra
Shield of the Ages
text: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

editions.flavor:
"This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

"This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

name: Shield of the Avatar
text:
If a source would deal damage to equipped creature, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of creatures you control.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
We are made stronger by those we fight for.
Designed by Richard Garriott

name: Shield of the Oversoul
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. If its toughness is 0 or less, it's still put into its owner's graveyard.)
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.

name: Shield of the Righteous
Shields of Velis Vel
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Creatures target player controls get +0/+1 and gain all creature types until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Changelings can alter shape based on what the beings around them desire most.

name: Shield Sphere
text:
Defender
Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.

editions.flavor:
"My soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

"My Soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Shield Wall
text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The strongest walls are made not of stone or steel but of the focused strength of warriors.

"If not for the wizard, we'd all be dead now. 'Course, it was him that started all this in the first place."
—Onean veteran

name: Shifting Borders
text:
Exchange control of two target lands.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Shifting Loyalties
text: Exchange control of two target permanents that share a card type. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker are card types.)

editions.flavor:
"Show the enemy the true path, and the spirit will yearn to follow it."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

name: Shifting Sky
text:
As Shifting Sky enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All nonland permanents are the chosen color.

editions.flavor:
Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying

Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying

name: Shifting Sliver
text: Slivers can't be blocked except by Slivers.

editions.flavor: Once the last few slivers the Riptide Project controlled were dead, there was nothing to keep the island from being completely overrun.

name: Shifting Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Shifting Wall enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor:
"You'd almost think Volrath doesn't want me here."
—Gerrard

name: Shifty Doppelganger
text: {3}{U}, Exile Shifty Doppelganger: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, that creature gains haste until end of turn. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice that creature. If you do, return Shifty Doppelganger to the battlefield.

name: Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked
text: As Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of permanents. Shimatsu enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: Their dominion over dark and destructive forces twisted the oni into beings of pure malevolence.

name: Shimian Night Stalker
text: {B}, {T}: All damage that would be dealt to you this turn by target attacking creature is dealt to Shimian Night Stalker instead.

editions.flavor:
"When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out/ Contagion to this world."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet
"‘Tis now the very witching time of night,/ When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out/ Contagion to this world." —William Shakespeare, Hamlet

name: Shimian Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Shimian Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Shimmer
text:
As Shimmer enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
Each land of the chosen type has phasing. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of his or her untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)

editions.flavor:
To buy unseen land, pay in unseen coin.
—Suq'Ata maxim

name: Shimmering Barrier
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Shimmering Efreet
text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Whenever Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out. (It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)

editions.flavor:
Life or death: which is the illusion?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Shimmering Glasskite
text:
Flying
Whenever Shimmering Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability.

editions.flavor: A child's whisper could crack its shell, but not even an oni's scream could penetrate it.

name: Shimmering Grotto
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"This is the price of being last in the food chain. We must keep our places of beauty hidden away instead of displayed for all to see."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn
Once each year, the sun's rays reach the hidden chamber of Velis Vel, and the changelings congregate from afar to bathe in the ever-shifting light.
Untold riches await those who forsake the bustling world to search the secret, silent places.

text:
Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Oh, is that all you need? Why didn't you just say so?"
—Reef shaman

name: Shimmering Wings
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The brighter the wings, the deeper the impact crater.

—Empress Galina

—Ixidor, reality sculptor

text:
Flash
You may cast artifact spells as though they had flash.

editions.flavor: It evades Phyrexians by hiding in the spaces between seconds.

text:
Haste

First strike

text:
Flying

{1}{W}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Shinewend: Destroy target enchantment.

name: Shining Shoal
text:
You may exile a white card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Shining Shoal's mana cost.
The next X damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or creatures you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.

name: Shinka Gatekeeper
text: Whenever Shinka Gatekeeper is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.

editions.flavor:
"Understanding is not a virtue of the ogre. Do not seek to reason your way into Shinka Keep."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Shinka, the Bloodsoaked Keep
text:
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{R}, {T}: Target legendary creature gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The glow from within looks inviting, but woe awaits whomever finds out who stokes the fire or what simmers in the pot.

text:
{6}{U}{U}: Monstrosity 4. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put four +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Shipbreaker Kraken becomes monstrous, tap up to four target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps for as long as you control Shipbreaker Kraken.

text:

Pay {E}: Shipwreck Moray gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Shipwrecks do wonders for the local fauna, providing both shelter and aether.

text:
Flying
{1}{U}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks this turn if able.
{1}{B}, {T}: Attacking creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Her melody melds death and beauty with such artistry that even the gods weep to hear it.

text: Whenever a creature with power 1 or less is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return that card to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step if Shirei, Shizo's Caretaker is still on the battlefield.

text:

{1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

text:

• Remove two time counters from target permanent or suspended card.

text:
Trample
When Shivan Wumpus enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice a land. If a player does, put Shivan Wumpus on top of its owner's library.

text:
Trample

name: Shivan Zombie
text: Protection from white

name: Shiv's Embrace
text:
Enchant creature

{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: When you see the world as a dragon sees it, everything looks fit to burn.

name: Shizo, Death's Storehouse
text:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{B}, {T}: Target legendary creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: Centuries ago, Shizo was a verdant field of wildflowers. After 891 samurai died in a single battle on its grasses, it became a haunted moor.

text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player adds {G}{G}{G} to his or her mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from that player's mana pool as steps and phases end.

Defender

editions.flavor:

text:
Flying
Whenever Shockmaw Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals 1 damage to each creature that player controls.

editions.flavor: Dragons of the Kolaghan brood are always on the move. They are the driving force behind the Mardu's nomadic way of life.

name: Shock Troops
text: Sacrifice Shock Troops: Shock Troops deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: When goblins blow themselves up, it's called stupidity. When humans do, it's called heroism.
War is a conflict that determines not who is right—but who is left.

name: Shoe Tree
text:
Shoe Tree comes into play with up to two shoe counters on it. Use your shoes as counters.
Shoe Tree gets +1/+1 for each shoe counter on it.

editions.flavor: It grows several feet a year.

name: Shorecrasher Elemental
text:
{U}: Exile Shorecrasher Elemental, then return it to the battlefield face down under its owner's control.
{1}: Shorecrasher Elemental gets +1/-1 or -1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Shorecrasher Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both green and blue, Shorecrasher Mimic has base power and toughness 5/3 until end of turn and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Aurora replaced the changelings' innocence with malice and their curiosity with hunger.

name: Shoreline Raider
text: Protection from Kavu

editions.flavor:
"This strange new beast makes for an excellent meal. Get me more."
—Empress Galina

name: Shoreline Ranger
text:
Flying

text: Whenever Shoreline Salvager deals combat damage to a player, if you control an Island, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"They search for treasures that wash up from the depths. Tracking one could lead you to riches. Or in circles."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Shore Snapper
text: {U}: Shore Snapper gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: Kathari, the sickly aven of Grixis, have learned that the corpses by the shoreline are more trap than treat.

name: Shoulder to Shoulder
text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Sea Gate may have fallen, but we still stand. We still fight."
—Gideon Jura

name: Shoving Match
text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain "{T}: Tap target creature."

editions.flavor: Rishadan barkeeps know something the Mercadians have yet to learn: if you keep pushing, someone will eventually push back.

name: Show and Tell
text: Each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."
At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."
At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."

name: Shower of Coals
text:
Shower of Coals deals 2 damage to each of up to three target creatures and/or players.
Threshold — Shower of Coals deals 4 damage to each of those creatures and/or players instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Shower of Sparks
text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.
The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.
The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

name: Show of Valor
text: Target creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Cowards watch. Heroes act.

"Duty, honor, and valor are either in your heart or they are not. You will never know for certain until you are tested."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Showstopper
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "When this creature dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature an opponent controls."

editions.flavor: The audience quickly realized a few things: it wasn't a magic trick, there wasn't candy in there, and they'd need new clothes.

name: Shrapnel Blast
text:
As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: To the Krark Clan, every artifact has a trigger and a barrel.
It requires immense pressure to imbue an item with magic. If the spell is broken . . .
From trinket to trauma.
From trinket to trauma.
